snippet: The expansion of the Yongbyon reactor complex was reported amid talk of easing tension with South Korea and the United States.
abstract: Washington monitoring group Institute for Science and International Security reports that North Korea appears to have doubled the size of the area used to enrich uranium at its Yongbyon reactor complex; report raises new concerns that North could increase production of weapons-grade fuel, even as it says it wants to relax tensions with South Korea and the United States.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and GERRY MULLANY
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Gerry Mullany from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The expansion of the Yongbyon reactor complex was reported amid talk of easing tension with South Korea and the United States.

headline.main: Study Suggests North Korea Is Doubling Area Devoted to Uranium Enrichment
headline.print_headline: Study Suggests North Korea Is Doubling Area Devoted to Uranium Enrichment

keywords.value: Institute for Science and International Security
keywords.name: organizations
